com.salesforce.androidsdk.rest
Class RestClient

java.lang.Object
  com.salesforce.androidsdk.rest.RestClient

public class RestClient
extends java.lang.Object

RestClient allows you to send authenticated HTTP requests to a force.com server.

Constructor Detail

RestClient

public RestClient(RestClient.ClientInfo clientInfo,
                  java.lang.String authToken,
                  HttpAccess httpAccessor,
                  RestClient.AuthTokenProvider authTokenProvider)
Constructs a RestClient with the given clientInfo, authToken, httpAccessor and authTokenProvider. When it gets a 401 (not authorized) response from the server:
  • If authTokenProvider is not null, it will ask the authTokenProvider for a new access token and retry the request a second time.
  • Otherwise it will return the 401 response.

Parameters:
clientInfo -
authToken -
httpAccessor -
authTokenProvider -

sendAsync

public void sendAsync(RestRequest restRequest,
                      RestClient.AsyncRequestCallback callback)

sendSync

public RestResponse sendSync(RestRequest.RestMethod method,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             HttpEntity httpEntity)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Send an arbitrary HTTP request synchronously, using the given method, path and httpEntity. Note: Cannot be used by code on the UI thread (use sendAsync instead).

Parameters:
method - the HTTP method for the request (GET/POST/DELETE etc)
path - the URI path, this will automatically be resolved against the users current instance host.
httpEntity - the request body if there is one, can be null.
additionalHttpHeaders - additional HTTP headers to add the generated HTTP request, can be null.
Returns:
a RestResponse instance that has information about the HTTP response returned by the server.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

sendSync

public RestResponse sendSync(RestRequest.RestMethod method,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             HttpEntity httpEntity,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHttpHeaders)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Send an arbitrary HTTP request synchronously, using the given method, path, httpEntity and additionalHttpHeaders. Note: Cannot be used by code on the UI thread (use sendAsync instead).

Parameters:
method - the HTTP method for the request (GET/POST/DELETE etc)
path - the URI path, this will automatically be resolved against the users current instance host.
httpEntity - the request body if there is one, can be null.
additionalHttpHeaders - additional HTTP headers to add the generated HTTP request, can be null.
Returns:
a RestResponse instance that has information about the HTTP response returned by the server.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
